H0.text: Citric acid is the acid contained in oranges and lemons.

H1.text: Nitric acid is the acid that oranges and lemons contain.

H2.text: Urea acid is the acid found in oranges and lemons.

H3.text: Beryllium acid is the acid found in oranges and lemons, which are examples of fruits that contain it.

A4.text: Citric acid occurs naturally in citrus fruits.

A5.text: The concentrations of citric acid in citrus fruits range from 0.005 mol/L for oranges and grapefruits to 0.30 mol/L in lemons and limes.
